required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Styloid Chain Calcification to the Patient With the Temporomandibular Joint Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Styloid Chain Calcification to the Patient With the Temporomandibular Joint Disorder: a Retrospective Uncontrolled Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to evaluate any relation between elongated styloid process (ESP) and type of Temporomandibular Joint Disorders (TMD).

detailed_description.textblock: The styloid process (SP) of the temporal bone is a long conical cartilaginous projection lies anterior to the mastoid process. Patients who have ESP or styloid chain calcification are usually asymptomatic, only 4% are symptomatic. Symptoms vary as different syndromes which related affected anatomic structures by calcified process or ligament. Temporomandibular Dysfunction (TMD) describe the temporomandibular joint (TMJ) disfunction that divided three branches according to temporomandibular joint's disc status: non-displacement (ND), displacement with reduction (DWR) and displacement without reduction (DWoR). Since orofacial pain shows similar features in both ESP or styloid chain calcification and TMD, it is possible to confuse and misdiagnosis both of these clinical conditions. This study aimed to investigate the length and calcification pattern of the styloid process in patients with TMD diagnosis.

primary_outcome.description: Interpretation of Styloid chain calsifiaction pattern on reconstructed sagittal slices of CBCT.
Styloid processes length measured linearly on reconstructed sagittal slices of CBCT.

arm_group.description: For this study, 154 patient files who were admitted to the radiology department of the faculty of dentistry between 2013 and 2019 with complaints such as TMJ pain, mouth opening restriction, joint sound, joint function disorder were scanned retrospectively. Inclusion criteria: TMD patients with MR and CBCT images recorded in the digital archive. Exclusion criteria: Patients who have been operated or treated from TMJ, patients with head and neck trauma, patients with orthodontic treatment.

study_pop.textblock: Patients have at least one of these clinic conditions: TMJ pain, mouth opening restriction, joint sound, joint function disorder.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical Diagnosis of Temporomandibular Dysfunction(TMD)
- TMD patients with MR and CBCT images recorded in the digital archive.
Exclusion Criteria:
- operated or treated for any Temporomandibular Joint Diseases
- head and neck trauma
- orthodontic treatment
